title: What Character do you think needs a good nerf? (Random Discussions)
body:
A lot of people have different opinions on what champion on league of legends should be **nerfed or is just straight up hated for being annoying or too overpowered in games**. But I'm curios to see what_** each person's opinion**_ of what champion needs a nerf the most. Post your thoughts below!

_I personally hate teemo and Kha 'Zix the most..._

[](http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/503/350/1f1.png)

replies.body: Zoe, because getting half your hp taken away from a lvl 6 Zoe is balanced.
Have you ever fought Zed or Fizz good sir?
Fizz legit jumps hops upside down on a trident and becomes invincible, what type of logic is that.
Zoe is worse then Zed or Fizz.

Lux.

Everyone complains how when Zoe lands her E, it's basically a death sentence, but the same can be said about Lux landing her Q

Yeah, Zoe needs the mighty nerf hammer so badly.

Apparently Rito are going to kill my top champ {{champion:50}} soon as well. I already lost my {{champion:3}} . Oh and {{champion:57}} too, Rito doesn't like me having fun.
They released Zoe, who do you think is meant to have fun?

I was going to make a post on it but the stupid boards URL linking wouldn't load the video properly

Zoe
https://youtu.be/TcI0SGmAtXs?t=526

Ls pretty much explains it, but it seems as though either Riot's infamous balance team is being sloppy and stupid again or maybe it's a sign of favouritism?

I seem to be one of the only players who doesn't have a problem playing against Zoe?

I really want to say Yasuo, or Lee Sin, but I wont... as much as it pains me not to hand them up on a silver platter, they both still have some level of counterplay.

I will say Fizz. 
Because there is literally 0 counterplay.
I have made several discussions on the boards ~~asking~~ begging, for someone to give me a good answer of how to play against him. No one has succeeded.

I mean the obvious and easier said than done answer is to wait out his E and dodge his ult. You kinda have to get in his head and predict it though. Bait out the E and all that. Think "if I was Fizz would I be looking for an ult right about now?".

I would argue Katarina tbh, because even hitting her with *on target* abilities is a nightmare cause she's never in the same place for more than .2 seconds, and if she's got 3 daggers on the ground you just have to roll the dice and hope you picked the right one oh nevermind she jumped to you and killed you instead.
#SALT

I was about to say thank goodness I don't see her all that much, but then I remembered that's because I always ban her. I'll take a Yas or a Lee Sin or a fed af Riven over Katarina any day. 

I agree with you on Zoe though. Having played her and vsed her, in my experience she really isn't OP. I agree with the nerf to the trap arm time, it was a little dicey to get out of even on a good day, but if you're paying attention like you should be she's really not that bad. Call it encouraging map awareness. Like if you're vsing a Vayne and she condemns you cause you were standing next to the wall, that's on you not on the Vayne.

I used to be a Fizz main _(back when I was young and stupid)_, so I usually have a pretty good idea of when he's going to do his stuff. but that still doesn't stop him tower diving you and getting away scot-free.

Idk, I just have issues with how his W takes time to charge up its damage _(to levels that are genuinely ridiculous)_, but you can't use that time to defend yourself, because he is untargetable, and you cant run away because you're slowed by 80% or knocked up. And when he does come down to earth, his _**utility**_ ability also does tons of AoE damage, AND also applies a 2nd slow, just to dispel any fleeting thoughts you had of escape. Then he just taps you with his W and you're back into a grey screen again.

____________

Agreed, Zoe is a menace, but she is a menace that can be played around with comparative ease. It's not that hard to stay behind minions, especially in mid lane. Her particles aren't the fastest and with the increased mobility champs have atm, it's not a huge stretch to predict and/or avoid them.

and it's not like she has much followup damage, she has a massive nuke, but not an awful lot else. if you're alive after she slaps you with her E/Q combo, RIP Zoe. Most people run away, but they should just jump on her. Like Aurelion Sol, he has tons of damage, so people run away and thats what gets them killed. Just like Sol, the safest place you can be is right next to Zoe.

I also agree with the E nerf, but I think the true problem is the drowsy time.
Either it needs to be shorter to allow Zoe less time to set up her combo, or it needs to be longer to allow the victim a little more time to position themselves to make her paddlestar less likely to hit.

Also, the CD does NOT need to be reduced when she hits someone.

But I play Zoe, quite a lot, so maybe I'm a little more aware of her weaknesses than most. 
I think she does err towards the OP side, but she isn't as broken as people make out. But of course I'm well aware that we all don't like thinking our own champs are broken. So my credibility isn't exactly bulletproof on this matter.

It's hard for me to comment on Fizz because honestly I just don't see him that much, and I'm also rarely his target and/or his lane enemy so even when he is in games, I rarely have to actually counterplay him.

As for Zoe, I like her, but I've also played against her a lot more than I've played as her, and I really don't feel she's that much of a problem, even as slow/low mobility champions. She's got one thing that she does really well. Counter that and no problem. Her E being a death sentence of any decently high CC champ in team fights. Lux, Morg, Thresh. Really anyone with a hard CC.

As for the CD being reduced when she hits someone, remember that it's literally her only escape. She has low escape potential, with only one long CD ability to help her out, whereas most other champs have more than one or one more reliable something.

All points aside
